#: Load unique instance types into the dimension table. Do not load unknown types as these are
Note that we need to update the start time if an older record is found for the same
instance type. This is ideally done with ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE
start_time = IF(start_time < VALUES(start_time), start_time, VALUES(start_time) but ETLv2
does not support explicitly setting that clause at this time. We solve this with a join
to the existing instance types and calculating the earliest start time.

records.start_time: IF(existing.start_time IS NULL OR UNIX_TIMESTAMP(CONVERT_TZ(raw.start_time,'+00:00', @@session.time_zone)) < existing.start_time, UNIX_TIMESTAMP(CONVERT_TZ(raw.start_time,'+00:00', @@session.time_zone)), existing.start_time)

joins.name: instance_type
joins.on: raw.resource_id = existing.resource_id AND raw.instance_type = existing.instance_type AND raw.display = existing.display AND raw.num_cores = existing.num_cores AND raw.memory_mb = existing.memory_mb and raw.disk_gb = existing.disk_gb
